CheckTitle: Server Side Excludes is enabled to hide sensitive content from bots
Description: **Cloudflare zones** are assessed for **Server Side Excludes** (Scrape Shield) configuration by checking if it is enabled to automatically hide content wrapped in SSE tags from visitors identified as **suspicious bots or crawlers**.
Risk:
Without **Server Side Excludes**, sensitive content remains visible to malicious bots.
- **Confidentiality**: sensitive information marked for exclusion can be scraped by bots
- **Integrity**: content may be indexed or misused by unauthorized crawlers
- **Availability**: scraped data may be used to plan further attacks

Code.Other:
1. Log in to the Cloudflare dashboard and select your account and domain
2. Go to Scrape Shield (or Security > Settings in newer UI)
3. Scroll to Server Side Excludes
4. Toggle the setting to On
5. Wrap sensitive content in SSE HTML comments in your page source

Recommendation.Text:
Enable **Server Side Excludes** and wrap sensitive content in SSE HTML comments.
- Provides selective content protection while maintaining functionality for legitimate visitors
- Use HTML comments to mark content for exclusion from suspicious visitors
- Part of the Scrape Shield feature set for comprehensive protection
- Combine with other anti-scraping measures for defense in depth

Notes: Server Side Excludes requires wrapping sensitive content with special HTML comments to mark content for exclusion. The syntax is: <!--sse-->sensitive content<!--/sse-->
